World: The location or world where the adventure takes place.

AdventureHook.Description: A container field for elements related to the story's adventure hook.
AdventureHook.Start: The initial event that sets the story in motion and motivates the characters to begin their quest.

Problems.Description: An array of objects, each detailing a particular problem or conflict in the story.
Problems.Name: The title or name of the problem.
Problems.ProblemDescription: A brief description of the problem, providing some background and its traits.
Problems.Solution: A potential solution to the problem that players can pursue.

WorldBuilding.Description: A container field providing more detailed information about the world setting.
WorldBuilding.WorldDescription: An overview of the world's landscape and geographical features.
WorldBuilding.History: The historical events and developments that have shaped the world.
WorldBuilding.Culture: The customs, traditions, social norms, and beliefs of the world's inhabitants.
WorldBuilding.Landmarks: Notable locations, monuments, or geographical features within the world.

Players.Description: An array of objects, each representing a player in the game.
Players.Name: The name of the player.
Players.PlayerDescription: A brief description of who the player is, providing some background and character traits.
Players.Race: The race of the player's character in the game.
Players.Class: The class or profession of the player's character.
Players.Level: The current level of the player's character.

Inventory.Description: An array of objects, each representing an item in the player's inventory.
Inventory.Name: The name of the item.
Inventory.ItemDescription: A brief description of the item, providing some background and its traits.
Inventory.Quantity: The quantity of the item the player currently has.

Equipment.Description: An array of objects, each representing a piece of equipment the player's character is using.
Equipment.Name: The name of the item.
Equipment.ItemDescription: A brief description of the item, providing some background and its traits.
Equipment.Quantity: The quantity of the item the player currently has.
Equipment.Type: The type or category of the item (e.g., weapon, armor, tool, etc.).
